intro: Polanisia kalachariensis, commonly known as the Kalahari polanisia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Due to its habitat in arid regions, it has adapted to survive in dry conditions with deep root systems and thick, waxy leaves.
